description: A web page designed as a learning aid for AP Statistics Unit 6 (Inference for Categorical Data: Proportions). It provides a structured learning flow, a visual flowchart, a helper for using the Grok AI assistant with specific materials, and a system for tracking progress through study topics.

dependencies.purpose: Utility-first CSS framework for styling the page.

dependencies.name: React
dependencies.purpose: Core library for building the interactive Learning Flow component.

dependencies.name: ReactDOM
dependencies.purpose: Library for rendering React components into the DOM.

dependencies.name: Babel Standalone
dependencies.purpose: Transpiles JSX syntax (used in the React component) directly in the browser.

dependencies.name: Mermaid JS
dependencies.purpose: Renders text-based definitions into diagrams (used for the flowchart).

javascript.scope: Global functions and event listeners, plus a React component.

coreFunctionality.description: Handles clicks on tab buttons, updates active styles, and shows/hides corresponding tab content panels.
Uses the `flowchartDefinition` string to render a flowchart diagram into the `#flowchart` div using Mermaid JS. Called when the Flowchart tab is activated.
Populates the `#grok-prompt` element and provides a button (`#copy-button`) to copy the prompt text to the clipboard.

Manages the display and interaction logic for study topics. Loads progress from localStorage, dynamically creates topic cards with links and checkboxes, updates progress bar, handles completion status for individual items (videos, quizzes) and entire topics, saves progress to localStorage, identifies and highlights the current/next topic, and manages the overall completion state.
coreFunctionality.data: `pdfFiles` array (object containing topic structure, links, and completion status), `localStorage` key 'apStatsUnit6TopicProgress'.

coreFunctionality.description: Updates the 'Current Topic' and 'Quick Access Topics' sections in the Grok Prompt tab based on the progress data managed by the Study Materials module.
A functional React component rendered into `#learning-flow-app`. Provides a multi-step guide with navigation (Previous/Next buttons), visual progress indication, and tips for each step.

dataStorage.purpose: Persists the completion status of videos, quizzes, and topics across browser sessions.
dataStorage.format: JSON string representing an array of topic progress objects.

dataSources.purpose: Defines static content and the initial structure/links for study materials.
Drives state changes and updates within the application (e.g., changing tabs, marking items complete).

interactivity: Checking/unchecking checkboxes marks items as complete/incomplete and updates progress.
Clicking 'Mark Topic as Completed' marks all items in a topic complete.
Selecting a topic from the dropdown scrolls to its card.
Navigating the React Learning Flow component (Prev/Next).
Clicking 'Reset Progress' clears stored progress data.
Clicking quick access topic cards sets the current topic in the Grok Prompt tab.
